Dear Sir or Madam,
Under Freedom of Information, I would be grateful if you could provide the following information:
- Number of manhole / drain covers stolen in 2023 (Jan-Dec 2023)
- If you do not record this information, please provide the number of manhole / drain covers replaced or reported missing in Jan-Dec 2023.
Where possible please add these to a spreadsheet
Many thanks for your help
Sian broad

Dear Sian Broad,
Thank you for your request for information relating to missing/stolen man
hole covers which we received on 31/01/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 28/02/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Sian Broad,
Thank you for your request for information relating to missing/stolen
manhole covers which we received on 31/01/2024.
Please see our response to your question below:
We can confirm that we have attended 229 reports of missing covers between
1 January 2023 and 31 December 2023 to either replace covers or make the
area safe with barriers.
This figure includes utility and/or gully covers, and those maintained by
Amey under the StreetsAhead contract but also those owned/ maintained by a
third party (eg. Yorkshire Water)
We are unable to identify which of these covers were stolen.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
